intro: Malva hispanica, commonly known as Spanish mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring broad, lobed leaves with a soft, fuzzy texture. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers with five petals, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. Malva hispanica is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine.
